intro: Sonerila konkanensis, commonly known as the Konkan Sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. It plays a significant role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar to various pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
